dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3813066E] DMCA Notification ISP Follow-up - www.taldalafil.com - Eli
dmca.body:
-----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Sent: Tuesday, April 10, 2007 10:48 AM To: Copyright Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3813066E] DMCA Notification ISP Follow-up - www.taldalafil.com - Eli Lilly ICOS (Cialis) ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. Tue, 10 Apr 2007 15:47:25 -0500 (CDT) X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5 Content-class: urn:content-classes:message MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/related; type="multipart/alternative"; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C77BB1.68DF18AC" X-ASG-Orig-Subj: DMCA Notification ISP Follow-up - www.taldalafil.com - Eli Lilly ICOS (Cialis) Subject: DMCA Notification ISP Follow-up - www.taldalafil.com - Eli Lilly ICOS (Cialis) Date: Tue, 10 Apr 2007 16:47:10 -0400 Message-ID: X-MS-Has-Attach: yes X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: DMCA Notification ISP Follow-up - www.taldalafil.com - Eli Lilly ICOS (Cialis) Thread-Index: Acd7sRr70mPMHVG4R0GrNuID/SXKVw== From: "Casey McIntosh" To: X-Virus-Scanned: by Barracuda Spam Firewall at ev1servers.net X-Barracuda-Spam-Score: 0.00 X-Barracuda-Spam-Status: No, SCORE=0.00 using global scores of TAG_LEVEL=4.0 QUARANTINE_LEVEL=1000.0 KILL_LEVEL=8.0 WHITELISTED Return-Path: cmcintosh@netenforcers.com X-OriginalArrivalTime: 10 Apr 2007 20:47:26.0463 (UTC) FILETIME=[728D28F0:01C77BB1] (multipart/related) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. (multipart/alternative) MIME element (text/plain) To whom it may concern, This is in regards to a Cease and Desist letter which was sent to you regarding your client www.Taldalafil.com and our client Eli Lilly ICOS (Cialis). Your client received a DMCA Notification informing them of the unauthorized use of copyrighted images and trademarked logos. They received this letter on 3/27/2007 and was given eight (8) days to comply. The website has been rechecked and I am showing your client has yet to comply. In regards to this issue, it should be known that the advertisement or sale of "Generic Cialis" is forbidden inside the US. Simply hosting a website that offers "Generic Cialis" is illegal. Also, the removal of all infringing Intellectual Property owned by Eli Lilly ICOS (Cialis) must be done to meet compliance. Please provide me with a follow-up on this by 4/13/2007. If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me via email at CMcIntosh@Netenforcers.com. Sincerely, Casey McIntosh LMS Representative Net Enforcers Inc. CMcIntosh@netenforcers.com compliance.management@netenforcers.com The Online Enforcement Specialists...... Statement of Confidentiality The contents of this e-mail message and any attachments are confidential and are intended solely for the addressee. The information may also be legally privileged. This transmission is sent in trust, for the sole purpose of delivery to the intended recipient. If you have received this transmission in error, any use, reproduction or dissemination of this transmission is strictly prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please immediately notify the sender by reply e-mail and delete this message and it's attachments, if any. Thank you. Original ISP Letter: 3/27/2007 7155 5474 4100 4343 8465 VIA CERTIFIED US MAIL RETURN RECEIPT REQUESTED Everyones Internet Everyones Internet 390 Benmar Suite 200 Houston TX 77060 Re: Notification of Copyright & Trademark Infringement Violation of Terms of Service www.Taldalafil.com Dear Sir or Madam: Our law firm represents Lilly ICOS LLC ("Lilly ICOS"), owner of the CIALIS® (tadalafil) prescription pharmaceutical product for the treatment of erectile dysfunction. This letter constitutes notification of claims of copyright infringement and/or trademark infringement, dilution, and unfair competition and violation of your Terms of Service. Lilly ICOS is the owner of the intellectual property rights in the CIALIS product. The CIALIS (tadalafil) compound and method of use are covered under U.S. Patent Nos. 5,859,006 and 6,140,329. The CIALIS trademark, the "swirl" logo, and the appearance of the CIALIS tablet are protected under U.S. Trademark Reg. Nos. 2,724,589, 2,833,221, and 2,833,222. The unique packaging for the CIALIS product, including the swirl logo, is protected by copyright, and has been registered with the U.S. Copyright Office under Reg. No. TX-5-713-466. The phrase or words "Generic CIALIS" is also copyrighted by Lilly ICOS, and its use is prohibited in the sale or advertised sale of Tadalafil (Generic CIALIS). These copyrighted works are entitled to protection against unauthorized reproduction, distribution, and display pursuant to U.S. and international copyright laws. Any person who uses the Lilly ICOS trademark-protected intellectual property in a manner which is likely to cause confusion,! cause mistake, or deceive consumers into believing that their product or website is sponsored by or affiliated with Lilly ICOS is in violation of Lilly ICOS' rights under U.S. law. It is illegal to sell "Generic CIALIS" or any other product containing tadalafil (other than authentic CIALIS) in the US or host a website selling Generic CIALIS into the US. It is also a violation of intellectual property to use the term Generic CIALIS. Copies of the copyright and trademark certificates of registration will be provided upon request. It is our understanding that you host the website located at www.Taldalafil.com (Taldalafil.com). Below are examples of infringing URLs hosted by the Website which illustrate the unauthorized use of the trademark-protected CIALIS brand name. This Website uses the trademark-protected CIALIS brand name to market such products as "Cialis (Apcalis)" tablets. The CIALIS trademark is also used in the source code and metatags for the site. Additionally, the Website displays a tablet which is identical or confusingly similar to the trademark-protected tablet design. http://taldalafil.com/ The www.Taldalafil.com site uses the trademark-protected CIALIS brand name on the site and in the source code and metatags for the site. The use of the CIALIS brand copyright-protected and/or trademark-protected materials on these sites is without any permission whatsoever from Lilly ICOS or its authorized agents. Such actions are in violation of Lilly ICOS' rights in its intellectual property under federal law and the materials on these sites constitute an ongoing infringement of Lilly ICOS' trademarks. These sites' purpose is to import and sell "Cialis (Apcalis)" tablets, which is particularly alarming because the United States Food and Drug Administration has not approved these medications for sale in the U.S. The sale and/or import of the purported "Cialis (Apcalis)" tablets into the U.S. is in violation of U.S. law including, but not limited to, the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, 21 U.S.C. § 301 et. seq., 21 U.S.C. § 355 (unapproved drug) and/or 21 U.S.C. § 352 (improper or unapproved labeling). Additionally, on June 13, 2006, the U.S. International Trade Commission issued a General Exclusion Order under 19 U.S.C. § 1337(G)(2) prohibiting the unlicensed importation into the U.S. of tadalafil or any salt or solvate thereof, and products containing same, covered by one or more claims 1-4, 6-8, 12 and 13 of '006 patent. We also believe that this website, www.Taldalafil.com, is in violation of your terms/rules prohibiting use of Everyones Internet's services for unlawful purposes. We ask you to investigate such a breach and enforce your terms/rules. By marketing unapproved and illegal counterfeit drugs, your customer also may be adversely affecting your public image, reputation and goodwill. Lilly ICOS also owns patent rights in the U.S. and throughout the world for its CIALIS product. This letter is written without prejudice to any other rights of Lilly ICOS LLC, including but not limited to claims for patent infringement. If you have questions, please contact Net Enforcers' Compliance Management Department via facsimile to 352-505-0040, or via email to Compliance.Management@NetEnforcers.com. All communication must be in writing. Net Enforcers is authorized to handle and resolve this matter with you and has already been involved with this case. Calls directly to Lilly ICOS will not be accepted. If Infringer does not respond to this demand as requested by 5:00 p.m. on 4/10/2007, we will assume that this demand has been rejected and will proceed accordingly. Sincerely, VCLM Law Lance C. Venable Attorney at Law LCV/roc MIME element (text/html)

To whom it may concern,

 

This is in regards to a Cease and Desist letter which was sent to you regarding your client www.Taldalafil.com and our client Eli Lilly ICOS (Cialis). Your client received a DMCA Notification informing them of the unauthorized use of copyrighted images and trademarked logos. They received this letter on 3/27/2007 and was given eight (8) days to comply. The website has been rechecked and I am showing your client has yet to comply. In regards to this issue, it should be known that the advertisement or sale of “Generic Cialis” is forbidden inside the US. Simply hosting a website that offers “Generic Cialis” is illegal. Also, the removal of all infringing Intellectual Property
